title: New Girl star Lamorne Morris is restrained and handcuffed by police outside a club in Hollywood
text:
Actor Lamorne Morris was handcuffed by police as he filmed them arresting his friend outside a nightclub in Hollywood on Saturday night, following an altercation with a bouncer

Actor Lamorne Morris was handcuffed by police as he filmed them arresting his friend outside a club in Hollywood on Saturday night, following an altercation with a bouncer.

The incident was captured on camera by a bystander, showing the New Girl star exchanging some terse words with an officer outside Avenue, on Cahuenga Boulevard, late yesterday.

Morris and his unnamed friend, who can be seen bleeding from his face, had apparently been involved in an incident with a security guard in the moments before.

The actor can be heard protesting his friend’s innocence to an officer, with his cell phone in hand, claiming the friend was the victim of the scuffle and had been attacked without provocation.

As Morris continues to document the arrest, a cop can be seen manhandling him, pushing him up against the wall and handcuffing him.

‘Now they’re arresting me!’ the actor can be heard yelling as a second officer approaches, continuing to argue with law enforcement who looked unsympathetic to his protests throughout the ordeal

‘Now they’re arresting me!’ the actor can be heard yelling as a second officer approaches, continuing to argue with law enforcement who looked unsympathetic to his protests throughout the ordeal.

'I play a f***ing cop on TV and this is how you treat me?' Morris continues to exclaim.

Ultimately, Morris was freed but was told he was temporarily detained for invading the police officer’s personal space – a justification he scoffed at.

‘It's so f***ing whack, man, that's crazy to me,’ he told TMZ. ‘They walked up to the n***** that's bleeding out the mouth and they put him in handcuffs. And I go, “wait, somebody hit him in the mouth!” And they go, “well, someone said that he started something.”’

Morris said he was trying to make it plainly clear to officers who instigated the fight, and to also inform them his friends were trying to remove themselves from the conflict when it broke out.

‘We are half a block away from the f***ing spot!’ he protested. ‘But you ain't questioning nobody else? And the only other person you put in cuffs is the guy recording you? Alright.

‘They just put me in cuffs because he said I ain't give him enough space. He said, “You didn't give me five feet.” I said, “bro, I'm right here! That's ten feet!'”

Morris is best-known for playing Winston Bishop, an LAPD officer, on Fox’s sitcom New Girl, which wrapped up its final season last year.

He was not charged in relation to Saturday night’s incident and was released moments afterwards.

The LAPD have not yet responded to a DailyMail.com request for comment.
